citation.article-title: Halomarina oriensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a halophilic archaeon isolated from a seawater aquarium
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Halomarina (Ha.lo.maâ€²ri.na. Gr. n. hals halos salt; L. adj. marinus -a -um marine; N.L. fem. n. Halomarina a halophile existing in the marine environment).
Gram-negative, aerobic, extremely halophilic, mesophilic and neutrophilic.
Cells contain C20C20 and C20C25 diether derivatives of phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol phosphate methyl ester, triglycosyl diether and at least one unidentified glycolipid.
Grows on a wide range of substrates, including single and complex carbon sources.
Grows in a wide range of NaCl concentrations.
Survives at low salt concentrations and can recover after prolonged exposure to distilled water.
The type species is Halomarina oriensis.
